comment: This is my desert-island whisky. No questions asked.

Glenmorangie original 10YO 40% 
American oak for 10YO

Spicy and peppery, raisin, vanilla note 2.25
Light spiciness, herbs, nutty 2.25
Finish light smooth fire 2.5
2.25

Many whisky drinkers will point to this as their launching point into scotch, which is fair enough as I too started my journey with Glenmorangie 10 along with Glenfiddich 12 and Johnnie Walker Black Label. But it wasn’t until i revisited Glenmorangie 10 many years later that I truly appreciated what a wonderful scotch this is. Many people will say that it’s just an easy sipping dram that offers light fruity notes, but the more time you spend with it you really get to  appreciate what a wonderful whisky this is.
Bit of a leathery touch to the nose, slight, barely noticeable smokiness to the finish and a fairly enjoyable if slightly forgettable taste.

flavor: hint of green apple, pineapple, sugar cane,  little caramel , vanilla
palate: sugar, malty, vanilla, after that bitterness with wood flavor , hint of herb and lemon, citrus.  When adding a little water, the flavor of sugar and malty become stronger , vanilla/toffee flavor .
After: medium, woody , honey with bitterness
Very elegant drum

This is a great "social" whiskey.  Its simple, not harsh or off putting, smooth and is exactly what I picture a good and honest Single Malt to be.  Yet, it can be had at such an affordable price point that it can be enjoyed while having good conversation about anything other than whiskey.
A good well balanced scotch. A bit Oakley.

Nose very fruity and warm at same time.
Palate delicate but fantastic. Citric fruits, nuts, delicate malt, sweet.
Love the finish, although many say it is short.
Best seller Single Malt in Scotland for years.

In my humble opinion, this Dram is just perfect. Nose has peaches and apricot.
Palate equally sweet. Just wonderful, but I am a novice single malt drinker.

Nose: Honey, vanilla, and candy orange 

Taste: Floral and oranges are the main notes. Very round and simple notes. Not of a lot of nuance
This has turned out to be one of my favorites.  The citrus, honey and a creamy finish... it's complex enough with a great balance of taste and scent.
Very well rounded, and if I can use the word soft. It's was pleasantly smooth.
Lingering aroma from the glencairn straight to the liver
Smooth, and a bit of citrus and floral on the end
